intro: Nepenthes × hibberdii, commonly known as the hybrid giant nepenthes, is a tropical pitcher plant that results from the cross between Nepenthes rafflesiana and Nepenthes villosa. It is characterized by its large, vibrant green to red-colored pitchers that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in high humidity and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its nectar-producing glands attract various insects, which then fall into the pitcher and are digested by the plant. This species is popular among carnivorous plant enthusiasts due to its striking appearance and unique ecological adaptations.
